faqs.name: How do brands achieve super fast page loads with Cloudflare?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Brands use Cloudflare's CDN, edge computing, and optimization features to deliver content closer to users, reducing latency by up to 45% while maintaining security.

faqs.name: What security features does Cloudflare provide for high-traffic sites?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Cloudflare offers WAF, DDoS protection, bot management, and SSL/TLS encryption, achieving 99.99% uptime for secure, high-performance web applications.

faqs.name: How does Cloudflare help with frontend platform collaboration?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Cloudflare's edge network enables real-time collaboration features, API request volume handling, and deployment previews for seamless team workflows.

howTo.name: How to Achieve Super Fast Page Loads with Cloudflare Security
howTo.description: Step-by-step guide to implementing Cloudflare for fast, secure web performance

step.name: Sign up for Cloudflare
step.text: Create a free Cloudflare account and add your website domain.

step.name: Enable CDN and Edge Computing
step.text: Activate Cloudflare's CDN to cache content at edge locations for faster delivery.

step.name: Configure Security Features
step.text: Set up WAF, DDoS protection, and SSL/TLS for secure, fast performance.

step.name: Optimize Performance
step.text: Use features like image optimization, minification, and bot management.

step.name: Monitor and Test
step.text: Use Cloudflare analytics to track improvements in speed and security.

schema.name: Clodo Framework Pricing
schema.description: Pricing plans for Clodo Framework including free open-source offering and enterprise support

faqs.name: Is Clodo Framework really free?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Yes, Clodo Framework is completely free and open source under the MIT License. You can use it for personal projects, startups, and enterprise applications without any licensing fees.

faqs.name: How much can I save compared to AWS Lambda?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Most applications see 80-90% cost reduction. For example, a SaaS with 100K monthly active users typically pays $25/month on Cloudflare Workers vs $125+/month on AWS Lambda.

faqs.name: How do I install Clodo Framework?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Install via npm: `npm install @tamyla/clodo-framework`. Use the quickstart to scaffold a service with `npx create-clodo-service my-app --type data-service`.

faqs.name: Does Clodo integrate with Cloudflare Wrangler and D1?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Yes. Clodo provides Wrangler automation for deployments and built-in helpers to run D1 migrations as part of CI and deployment workflows.

faqs.name: Is Clodo Framework free for production use?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Yes. Clodo Framework is open source under the MIT License. You only pay for Cloudflare usage (Workers, D1, and any other paid services).

docs.name: Clodo Framework Documentation Hub
docs.description: Complete guide to building enterprise SaaS applications on Cloudflare Workers with Clodo Framework

faqs.name: What is Clodo Company?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Clodo Company is a leading developer productivity tooling startup to accelerate cloudflare worker services based serverless application development for startup & enterprise SaaS development

faqs.name: How does Clodo cloud framework` work?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Our cloud suite is a productivity toolkit for service providers that offers an instant serverless application and worker services. It provides a pre-built scaffolding capability for Cloudflare development teams to build production SaaS applications 10x faster with built-in security, multi-tenancy, and cost optimization.

schema.headline: Cloudflare: What Is Edge Computing — Deep Developer Guide
schema.description: A developer-focused deep dive into edge computing, tied to Clodo Framework implementation examples and benchmarks.
schema.author: Clodo Framework

metrics.name: Median response time — Edge (Cloudflare Workers)
metrics.description: Synthetic median RTT measured for a small edge function (sample), representing typical real-world response times at the edge.

metrics.name: Median response time — Cloud-only
metrics.description: Synthetic median RTT for a comparable cloud-hosted endpoint (sample), representative of centralized cloud latencies.

metrics.name: Cache hit latency (P95)
metrics.description: Cache hit 95th percentile latency for edge cache hits (sample).

faqs.name: What is the difference between edge computing and cloud computing?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Edge computing processes data near users for lower latency and reduced bandwidth, while cloud computing uses centralized data centers for heavy processing and storage.

faqs.name: How does Cloudflare implement edge computing?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Cloudflare runs Workers and caches at global edge locations so code and content execute close to users for better performance and reliability.

faqs.name: When should I use edge computing?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Use edge computing for latency-sensitive features, real-time personalization, streaming, and IoT data processing where responsiveness matters.

faqs.name: How do I get started as a developer?
faqs.acceptedAnswer: Build small edge functions, measure latency gains, and progressively move logic to the edge while monitoring performance and cost.

howTo.name: Deploy a Clodo service to the edge (quick start)
howTo.description: Scaffold, test, and deploy a Clodo service to Cloudflare Workers and observe latency gains.

steps.name: Install Clodo Framework
steps.text: Install Clodo Framework with `npm install @tamyla/clodo-framework` or add it to your project dependencies.

steps.name: Scaffold a service
steps.text: Run `npx create-clodo-service my-edge-service --type data-service` to generate a Workers-ready starter project.

steps.name: Configure Workers & D1
steps.text: Add D1 bindings, environment variables and `wrangler.toml` settings for routes, accounts and secrets.

steps.name: Test & benchmark
steps.text: Run locally (e.g., `npm run dev` or `wrangler dev`) and measure latency improvements compared to a cloud-based variant.

steps.name: Deploy & monitor
steps.text: Deploy to Cloudflare, run synthetic latency tests, and use monitoring/logs to verify performance and reliability.
